text: not sure if this is the right channel. we are using HubSpot as our CMS and newsletter tool. so before users sign up to our product (we use azure ad b2c for the login) there is a good chance they already interacted with HubSpot (ie. have a cookie) and in some cases we already have their email in HubSpot. now we want to make sure we can track the original source per user that sign up. during the sign up process we get their email and then re-direct back to "download" page on HubSpot CMS, from there we redirect to the chrome/firefox store. I want to make sure that we as quickly as possible associate the email to the user on HubSpot if we previously didn't collect their email. is there a GET parameter or something that I can attach to the URL to the "download" page that will ensure that the email is associated with the user based on their tracking cookie?

so I am talking about the scenario that the user does have a HubSpot tracking cookie but HubSpot does not yet have their email and I am redirecting from a system that does have the email to a HubSpot CMS page
Hello guys i have a issue that how we can passed the authorization bearer access token in webhook and how we can connect a workflow with our public app .
anyone help me how to add fuctionalities in our HubSpot app
Hey, I'm affraid that is true:
You can easly check that for any property of any type via API: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/contact>

Following the <https://app.HubSpot.com/developer/23460389/application/1279223/sample-app-checklist|sample-app-checklist> I am stuck at:
"Visit your app's install URL in a web browser to install it" step

Here is what the install looks like for me:

<@U01QVR44MEY> and <@U03MLCLS5BN> Thanks for your help! I created a Ticket #11440225.  When I use the contact method to get usage, I always get a very minimal usage count and its completely different from the HAPI Count...seems like its possibly my usage count vs overall account usage.  Contacts:500000/499998, HAPI: 500000/28835.  I appreciate all you guys do on here!
Hello community, anyone knows how to add the Stripe pachage to a serverless function?
Are you using a private app for the auth?
If so each private app is subject to it's own limits so that's why you would notice those response headers being a little low on usage
You can read all about the metrics here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details>

Carter beat me - I was going to say this is because of your rate limits. Possibly the calls being made using a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details#rate-limits|HAPI key> count against a different rate limit
They do, at least thats how I read the docs
You could do this with webpacks or also try to get in the newest alpha for including packages in serverless functions. You'll probably want to talk with you CSM about both options
Does webpacks require CLI ?
Yes: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-webpack-serverless-boilerplate> you can also try and get into the alpha which is a little cleaner

That's how it reads to me as well, and how it seems to be acting...just does not make sense that HubSpot would do that.
It seems like if I have 5 APPS they EACH have 500k of processing per day.
I will just keep an eye on it!
Thank you both!

Any idea when the Automation API will support more than just contact-based workflows? It looks like it hasn’t supported company-based, deal-based, or custom-object-based workflows for a couple years. I know at least one of V1 or V2 used to support company-based and deal-based workflows. Any known plans to ever provide support for those?

Additionally, I’m struggling to find how I would manage field-level permissions via the API anywhere in the documentation. I’m assuming that just means it’s not supported. Totally understandable if not, but any idea when that will be supported?
Per <@U0157R7AQ84> this is on the teams radar and might come in Q1 or Q2
You need to change your redirect url in the app settings
Yeah currently this isnt supported the workaround for now is to permission sets and then creating a user with that permission set

Looking to script the creation of association tables, the “Customize association tables” functionality in the attached screenshot.

I’ve checked the API documentation for each object, associations, and I’ve looked at “Extending the CRM” > “Custom Cards”. We can deploy an application just for the client to use if that’s absolutely necessary, but we aren’t even sure it will allow us to do what we’re looking to do. I’ve had no luck finding a clear endpoint.

I totally understand, and I’m not trying to criticize. You guys have your priorities, and I completely respect that, but needing access to parts of the UI that isn’t supported via the API has been a trend for us with HubSpot - I have more than just the above issues. Again, I’m not at all mad, and I mean no disrespect! You guys have plenty on your plates, and there’s no reason providing us with API access should be a top priority. That being said, we’re getting to the point where we’re feeling like encouraging clients to migrate off of HubSpot. Again, it’s no hard feelings, we just want to be forthcoming where we’re at and provide honest feedback if helpful. We’re not making a switch right now, and wanting to avoid it entirely, but is there any intention to have parity with the API and UI in the near future? There may always be a few small things one might be able to do via the UI that they can’t via API, but as it stands, a significant portion of the CRM functionality that we need is not supported.

Just want to make it clear one more time, though! I appreciate you guys, and this is just meant to be transparent feedback regarding where we’re at, not a criticism, as I totally understand that you can’t do everything at once! :sweat_smile:
Thanks!

Thanks, Carter! I might be a bit confused about how to modify field-level permissions in the Permission Sets UI. Here it looks a bit more high-level, and focused more on how the data is federated than the configuration of the properties. Might I be misunderstanding you? Sorry if my initial message about what I was looking for wasn’t clear! :sweat_smile:

To clarify my specific issue here, attempting to create the tables via a private app in CRM Development hasn’t worked because it lists all of the records of the object rather than exclusively those associated, and I can’t find any documentation on filtering to just the associated records.

Hi Luke, acknowledging that this feature currently is limited and will not allow you to filter the records. Is your use case about customizing the record page using association tables? I would like to know what would you like to do with the API available that you can’t achieve with UI?

Don’t get me wrong, I get your point about API parity, but from your comment it looks like UI was not enough for you and you have a specific need from the API, which I am trying to understand. If it’s okay, I would like to schedule 30 min conversation to get your points better. <https://meetings.HubSpot.com/sparikh1>

Also, you may be looking at the the docs for CRM card supported by API (public apps). The CRM development tools beta docs are in the app, and public docs for components are available here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-custom-crm-cards-with-projects>
<@U04DUMWKMGU> this is very helpful, thank you!! :pray:
here's an article that lays it out for you <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/restrict-view-edit-access-for-properties>
of course

He's talking about limiting the record that show in the tables the crm cards (built with developer projects) I believe <@U04EFF323TL> correct me if I'm wrong. I'll go on the defensive of HubSpot and say that do to the newest of crm extensions (via projects) the HubSpot team doesn't really know what components are working really well and not working really well (do to limited feedback, thank you for providing this).
This article will also be an awesome read for general permission management in HubSpot <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/settings/HubSpot-user-permissions-guide>
